column4: hello. I have nvidia  8400M GS on an HP laptop, wiht ubuntu 8.04. I have installed the  NVIDIA-Linux-x86_64-173.14.12   . When I restarted gdm everything was ok. But when I rebooted the pc it starts in low graphics mode 800x600. If I go and reinstall the drivers then after running gdm again everything is fine. But it seems that the settings aren't saved . Any ideas? I could provide any more info if you need it...
you need to set some resolutions in xorg.conf

http://rafb.net/p/Oe4XrO33.html  here's the output of the xorg.conf . Any ideas where should I set the resolution? And why is the resolution correct when I build the drivers and then restart gdm. It doesn't work only after reboot
http://pastebin.com/f594ec754 heres mine, i run at 1024x768
add the resolution subsections from my screen section and you should be ok
backup the original xorg.conf before playing
:) yes
any good?
I tried to insert some resolution to the xorg but no... after reinstalling the drivers it plays. After restarting gdm still nothing :(
can i see your new xorg.conf please
http://rafb.net/p/nhKwJ298.html   I haven't edited the xorg.conf myself again so I might have done sth wrong...
you havent added anything
you added it in monitor, you need them in screen

If I want to use higher resolution and effects I should manually edit my preferences... So the xorg.cong I currenty have is http://pastebin.com/d3b75ec2a  ... :(
